intro: Donella letestuana, commonly known as the Florida rocknettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the edges of swamps and marshes. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are opposite, with a rough, hairy texture. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other species such as willowherbs and evening primroses. Donella letestuana is often found in wetland habitats and plays a role in supporting local ecosystems.
